description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Seville" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Seville

places.generalDescription: The Royal Alc√°zar of Seville is a landmark Moorish royal palace featuring fountain-filled gardens, ornate arches, and 16th-century tiles. It is considered one of the finest examples of Mudejar architecture in Spain, showcasing a blend of Moorish and Renaissance styles. The palace complex has a rich history dating back to the 10th century when it was initially built as a Moorish fortress.

sources.snippet: Seville, an aesthetically pleasing port city has the best for nightlife, pubs, an amazing range of authentic Spanish restaurants and more that you can enjoy. You will find plenty of romantic things to do in Seville, starting from relaxing Arab baths, a stroll across the outstanding river, exploring the festivities of Santa Cruz neighbourhood and more.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Seville

sources.snippet: The Real Alc√°zar is more than just a set of impressive palaces; its gardens are a true tranquility oasis. Walking hand in hand among fountains, peacocks, and hidden paths feels like stepping into a fairytale. Not to Miss: The Pergola of the Labyrinth, a secret and enchanting spot within the gardens, perfect for a stolen kiss.
sources.shortName: Romantic Seville: A Local's Guide for Couples

sources.snippet: Immerse yourself in the history and architecture of the Alc√°zar of Seville, a royal palace that will transport you to times of romance and splendour. Explore together its lush gardens and let yourself be carried away by the magic of this unique place.

sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Seville 2024

sources.snippet: Among the most enigmatic places of this World Heritage site, we highlight the Baths of Do√±a Mar√≠a de Padilla. In these almost hidden baths, you will see an elegant water tank dominating the room.
sources.shortName: Experience your most romantic trip in Seville

places.name: Royal Alc√°zar of Seville

reviews.text:
The Real Alc√°zar of Seville is an exceptional place - we absolutely loved it!
The site is very large, and we visited in April when everything was green and in full bloom. It was truly beautiful.

We highly recommend wearing comfortable shoes, as there's a lot of walking involved. Don't forget to bring water and take your time - there are plenty of perfect spots for photos and relaxing strolls.

It's essential to buy tickets well in advance. We purchased ours two weeks before our visit and could only get the last available time slot. After booking, you have to wait for a confirmation email.

Make sure to get your tickets long before your trip, as entrance is strictly based on the time stated on your ticket - no early entries were allowed for anyone.
We didn't had a guide and were able to enjoy the garden.

To fully enjoy the visit, it's a good idea to prepare children ahead of time and let them know there will be quite a bit of walking involved üòÑüëç

Royal Alc√°zar of Seville is one of the key landmarks when visiting Seville.  We went over the August Bank holiday weekend and it was BUSY - as you'd expect, not to mention incredibly hot, both inside and out.  Take a fan and plenty of water as the place is large!  There is a cafe but we didn't use it.  There seems to be a lot of recommendations about booking in advance, but we booked at about 10pm on Saturday night and got tickets for 11.30 the next morning.  Maybe we were lucky or August is quieter... I don't know.  Book to be on the safe side - I'd recommend using a local operator if poss - prices range from ¬£50 each to ¬£17pp which we opted for!  That said, this didn't include a tour / audio. There were QR codes but didn't try those.  Nothing is in English either - just an observation.  Inside, the palace consisted of a series of interconnected rooms, mainly empty (no furniture) with the exception of beautiful mosaic floors, ceilings, walls, tapestries and plaster work, open courtyards, you get the idea.  Gardens were gorgeous.  Evidently, you can see the Royal bedrooms but have to book far in advance of your visit.

A magnificent and very beautiful palace, as if you were in a medieval museum, a mixture of Western and Eastern civilizations, Christianity and Islam, a mixture of green nature and beautiful human heritage. Visiting it with the cathedral is definitely worth the trip.

places.address: Casco Antiguo, 41004 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Plaza de Espa√±a is a landmark square in Seville, featuring a large water feature, seats adorned with painted ceramic tiles, and an ornate pavilion. It's a great spot for families to visit, as kids can enjoy exploring the plaza while adults admire its inspiring architecture. To engage children, you can introduce them to the plaza by showing them scenes from Star Wars where it was featured.

sources.snippet: It symbolizes the embrace of Spain to its former Latin American colonies, and therefore built for the Iberoamerican Exhibition celebrated in Seville in 1929. Attached to the Parque de Maria Luisa, is necessary to emphasize the spectacular  semi-elliptical gallery, its central big fountain and the surrounding channel, through which multiple couples and visitors stroll by boat, all this endows to the Square of Spain with a deep romanticism where live unforgettable moments. 4.- Royal Palace / Real Alcazar in Seville.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places in Seville

sources.snippet: The city‚Äôs architecture, which includes the Giralda, Alc√°zar of Seville, and stunning Plaza Espa√±a, transports couples to another era, where romance flows through the narrow, winding streets. The enchanting Triana neighborhood, known for its vibrant local culture, offers another glimpse into the soul of Seville, making it ideal for romantic getaways.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaways and Dining in Seville

sources.snippet: Plaza Espa√±a, its architectural grandeur, their bows and corners are its main attractions. The Real Alcazar of Seville, a palace full of cultural richness, gardens where the scent of flowers surrounds us and makes us relive those years where the palace was filled with stories and legends.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places in Seville

sources.snippet: From streets lined with orange trees, heavenly scented blossoms in the spring, to Parque Maria Luisa with its Plaza de Espana.
sources.shortName: A Guide to the Most Romantic City in Andalucia

places.name: Plaza de Espa√±a

reviews.text: Magnificent! A simply amazing place to visit. Nobody wouldn't like the beautiful architectures and the smart designs. It really deserves the name of "Plaza de Espa√±a", it truly shows how grand an empire was and how brilliant the people were. Visited twice, both in the morning and the evening, and both breathtakingly beautiful. I really like the fountain, not a big fan of the horse carts though. In general really a landmark and nice place you wouldn't want to miss when in Seville.

The amounts spent on these construction projects are just mind-blowing. And when you remember how many people lost their health or even died there, it gets uncomfortable.

1. Tourists today admire the marble, the gold, the columns-but for someone, all this cost a life. Nobody remembers the names of the workers, though nothing would exist without them.

2. Sometimes I look at these buildings and think: was all this beauty really worth those sacrifices? For some, it's a symbol of the nation, but for others, it's years and strength lost.

Honestly, I'm always a bit envious of the architects of that time-to plan something on this scale takes real talent. But at the same time, I feel for those who paid for this ‚Äúeternity‚Äù with their health.

I can't feel just one way about it. The architecture is impressive, but the price was enormous. Sometimes you look at a cathedral and realize there's a heavy shadow behind all that beauty.

What about you? Can you just admire places like these, or do you also think about the price?

Plaza de Espa√±a is one of Seville's most iconic landmarks and an absolute must-see. Located in Mar√≠a Luisa Park, the square combines Renaissance Revival and Moorish architecture, creating a stunning and unique atmosphere.

The semi-circular building, the tiled bridges, and the beautiful canal make the place feel like a dream. Each Spanish province is represented through colourful ceramic tiles, adding cultural depth to beauty.

Whether you rent a boat, take photos, or just walk around and admire the views,the music , the flamingo. the experience is unforgettable-especially at sunset. It's peaceful, grand, and full of charm.

places.address: Av. Isabel la Cat√≥lica, 41004 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: La Giralda is a stunning Spanish Renaissance-style minaret with a Gothic and baroque bell tower. It's part of the diverse and beautiful monuments in Seville, including the Cathedral, Reales Alcazares, Torre del Oro, Plaza de Espana, Maria Luisa Park, and more. Seville offers an array of tourism options from historical tours to tapas and wine tours.

sources.snippet: Visiting the Seville Cathedral and climbing the Giralda can be a very romantic experience, especially when admiring the city views from atop this ancient tower. Special Moment: Right at dusk, as the city lights begin to twinkle, is the perfect time to enjoy this view. If you are a couple who likes to learn about history, you can book a guided tour of the Cathedral of Seville.
sources.shortName: Romantic Seville: A Local's Guide for Couples

sources.snippet: The city‚Äôs architecture, which includes the Giralda, Alc√°zar of Seville, and stunning Plaza Espa√±a, transports couples to another era, where romance flows through the narrow, winding streets. The enchanting Triana neighborhood, known for its vibrant local culture, offers another glimpse into the soul of Seville, making it ideal for romantic getaways.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaways and Dining in Seville

sources.snippet: Discover Royal Alcazar of Seville, Visit Seville Cathedral, Explore La Giralda, Checkout Setas de Sevilla, Visit Siam Park, Watch some bull fighting at Plaza de toros, Explore Seville Aquarium, Seville Museum of Fine Arts Tour and many more.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Seville

places.name: La Giralda

reviews.text:
The bell tower is the highlight of the cathedral visit. It offers panoramic views over the city and is well worth the climb.
Unlike many towers, it doesn't have stairs but a gently sloping ramp, making the ascent easier.
Restrooms and water dispensers are available nearby, and it's a good idea to buy your tickets in advance.

Climbing the tower is optional on a visit to the cathedral. It's a sloped path - not stairs which helped make it feel easier. There are a lot of level window nooks with flat seating for when you need a break. It would say it's moderately steep, but doable, especially because there are opportunities to rest. The up/down traffic is on the same path which made it a bit crowded in places. But the view at the top is beautiful. The frequent windows did let in some fresh air and slight breeze, but it was pretty warm in early June about noon.

Majestic and timeless, Seville Cathedral and the Giralda offer an unforgettable experience. After admiring the vast Gothic interior, visitors face a demanding ascent. While the official description highlights ramps and a few steps, the full route - including upper levels and the rooftop perimeter - amounts to more than 300 steps. In Seville's heat, it is wise to carry water, wear comfortable shoes, and avoid peak hours. The effort is richly rewarded with breathtaking views and a profound sense of Seville's historic soul.

places.address: Av. de la Constituci√≥n, s/n, Casco Antiguo, 41004 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Setas de Sevilla, also known as Las Setas, is a striking and modern architectural installation in Seville. Designed by German architect Jurgen Mayer, it is recognized as the world's largest wooden structure. The mushroom-shaped parasol offers visitors the opportunity to explore an archaeological museum and take in panoramic views of the city from its rooftop walkway and viewpoint.

sources.snippet: Discover Royal Alcazar of Seville, Visit Seville Cathedral, Explore La Giralda, Checkout Setas de Sevilla, Visit Siam Park, Watch some bull fighting at Plaza de toros, Explore Seville Aquarium, Seville Museum of Fine Arts Tour and many more.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Seville

places.name: Setas de Sevilla

reviews.text:
The Setas de Sevilla is a really cool and unique landmark. It's this huge, modern wooden structure right in the middle of a historic square, and I loved the contrast. It's a great place to just hang out below, grab a drink, and people-watch.

The best part, though, is going up to the top. The walkway is so fun to wander around, and you get some of the most amazing panoramic views of the city. Seeing all the rooftops and landmarks from a different perspective is a great experience. I went just before sunset, and the golden light over Seville was absolutely magical. It's a great spot for photos and a nice way to end the day.

It has a unique design and is quite an interesting place. It's a good spot to sit and relax in the morning or early afternoon, and it looks beautiful in the evening with the lighting. The area is generally lively. You can go up with a ticket and walk around, but I haven't tried it.

A great place to view the whole of Seville. This modern structure stands out in its surroundings and is an amazing piece of architecture.
Amazingly helpful staff and great audio guide provided on your walk around the skyline walkways.
Was a little disappointed with the lights in the dark. Feel like they need to invest in bulb replacement schedule, lots of areas not lit up.

places.address: Pl. de la Encarnaci√≥n, s/n, Casco Antiguo, 41003 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Seville Museum of Fine Arts is housed in a 17th-century palace that was originally a convent. Founded by St. Peter Nolasco, it's the second most important Spanish art museum in Spain and boasts an impressive collection of Sevillan Baroque paintings from the 17th century Golden Age. The museum features works by renowned artists such as Greco, Velazquez, Zurbaran, Murillo, Valdes Leal, and Francisco de Herrera the younger.

sources.snippet: Seville, an aesthetically pleasing port city has the best for nightlife, pubs, an amazing range of authentic Spanish restaurants and more that you can enjoy. You will find plenty of romantic things to do in Seville, starting from relaxing Arab baths, a stroll across the outstanding river, exploring the festivities of Santa Cruz neighbourhood and more.

sources.snippet: If you and your partner are art lovers, the Museum of Fine Arts is a must-see in the city of Seville. To visit it is to find 13 rooms full of the works of the greatest painters and sculptors of Spain such as: Goya, Vel√°zquez, Vald√©s Leal or Zurbar√°n.
sources.shortName: The 9 Romantic Places in Seville that will surprise you

sources.snippet: Open every day but Monday, the museum is a gorgeous but manageable collection of mainly Spanish art from Medieval times through the 20th century.
sources.shortName: 17 Magical Things to Do in Seville

places.name: Seville Museum of Fine Arts

reviews.text: A very fine museum containing a number of small treasures in a rather pleasant setting! The works are well laid out and the staff are friendly. Don't miss the chapel, which has been transformed into an exhibition room! What's more, it's cheap, air-conditioned and not very busy.

This is a beautiful museum housed in a converted monastery, with lots of greenery in the courtyard and high ceiling interiors. Free entry for EU citizens or Euro1.5 per person otherwise, this place is surprisingly not crowded. The art is heavily on religious collections from the baroque, renaissance era.

Beautiful museum with fantastic collection of artists from baroque onwards from Seville and wider Spain and Europe. Very well kept gardens. European residents are free otherwise is only ‚Ç¨1.50 for others. Very peaceful and quiet when we visited in the early afternoon.

places.address: Pl. del Museo, 9, Casco Antiguo, 41001 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Parque de Mar√≠a Luisa is a significant urban park in Seville, offering scenic plazas with landscaped gardens, fountains, and monuments. The park is part of an area that includes various notable landmarks such as the Giralda, the Cathedral, Reales Alcazares, Torre del Oro, Plaza de Espa√±a, and more. It's a must-visit destination in Seville and provides a comprehensive insight into the essence of the city.

sources.snippet: Maria Luisa Park, a small forest with roads between vegetation, benches in the shade or a carriage ride are two of the many options we have to spend time in good company. The Guadalquivir river, a walk along the riverside near the ancient tower of gold, stop for a drink and continue or sit watching the sunset; a boat trip and observe the wonders of Seville. Plaza Espa√±a, its architectural grandeur, their bows and corners are its main attractions.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places in Seville

sources.snippet: Declared as a cultural interest site, the Mar√≠a Luisa Park is without a doubt the most beautiful park of Seville. Built in 1924, these gardens were a private part of the San Telmo Palace, and weren‚Äôt donated to the people of the city until 1893. Inside this historical park you can find numerous little squares and gardens that will create a unique environment for your marriage proposal.
sources.shortName: Best places in Seville for a marriage proposal ‚Äì Photo Tour Seville ‚Äì Things to do, activities and what to see in Seville

sources.snippet: For these reasons, it is easy to think of the Maria Luisa Park as one of the most romantic places in Seville, for which over the years have walked thousands of couples in love. 3.- Plaza de Espa√±a / Spain Square. It symbolizes the embrace of Spain to its former Latin American colonies, and therefore built for the Iberoamerican Exhibition celebrated in Seville in 1929.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places in Seville

sources.snippet: There are official stops for horses and carriages at the Cathedral (internal link), the Mar√≠a Luisa Park, the Plaza de Espa√±a, and the Tower of Gold. But if you want to really surprise the one you love, then a carriage could even pick you up from your hotel. You‚Äôll take a tour around the city‚Äôs most spectacular sights that will last for about 45 to 60 minutes.
sources.shortName: Romantics plans for two in Seville

sources.snippet: Jardines ofrecidos por la infanta Mar√≠a Luisa de Borb√≥n, (duquesa de Montpensier), a la ciudad de Sevilla en 1893. Su trazado irregular est√° inspirado en el concepto del amor rom√°ntico, apasionado y salvaje. No en vano, fue un ingeniero franc√©s, Jean-Claude Nicolas Forestier, conservador del bosque de Boulogne de Par√≠s, quien le dio ese toque.
sources.shortName: Romantic Spots in Seville

sources.snippet: The Gardens of Maria Luisa Park, with their lush greenery, picturesque fountains, and hidden pathways, offer the perfect backdrop for a romantic stroll. Whether you‚Äôre walking together through the shaded avenues or finding a quiet bench, the beauty of the park surrounds you. In fact, it creates the perfect setting for a peaceful escape.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaways and Dining in Seville

sources.snippet: First of all the Maria Luisa Park is the park of Maria Luisa herself, but on 18 April 1914 it was donated to the Spanish public. This park is now famous for the wonderful gardens and the colourful flowers. It is a way to spend a perfect romantic day together.

sources.snippet: Seville is full of beautiful spots that are the perfect backdrop for a walk full of love. With its incredible green spaces and fountains, the Maria Luisa Park is an idyllic place to walk hand in hand with your partner.

sources.snippet: Small squares, benches and trails to get lost for a few minutes. Stand in front of the greatest exponent of Sevillian Romanticism and admire the B√©cquer roundabout or guide your steps to the top of Gurug√∫ hill.

places.name: Parque de Mar√≠a Luisa

reviews.text: Stunning well kept park, perfect place to relax and listen to the bird song.  Beautiful gardens, water fountains, and statues right next to the Plaza de Espa√±a, you can get a tram from the city centre, highly recommended.

Beautiful park right next to the Plaza de Espa√±a. We went there for a quiet stroll after visiting the Plaza de Espa√±a.

In the park you can find shade, made beautiful trees, plants and a wide variety of animals.

We also enjoyed the art in the park and the quiet sounds of the trees, the bushes and the animals.

Go there if you want a quiet break in the warm city.

The park is so beautiful and lovely! I simply enjoyed the vibe here and had a wonderful time just taking a morning walk in it. You can feel the balanced mixture of nature and human in this place, all the colors and cool architectures are also making visiting this place a unique experience. Definitely recommend to come and visit, such a nice place to chill and relax.

places.address: 41013 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Bas√≠lica de la Macarena is situated in the northern part of Seville's city center, within the Macarena neighborhood. It houses the revered religious figure, La Virgen de la Esperanza Macarena (The Virgin of Hope Macarena), commonly known as La Macarena.

sources.snippet: Visit the Basilica de la Macarena, to get a glimse at the two most impressive floats used during Semana Santa (Holy Week).
sources.shortName: A Guide to the Most Romantic City in Andalucia

places.name: Bas√≠lica de Santa Mar√≠a de la Esperanza Macarena

reviews.text:
This is a famous and important church in Seville. The hermansdad of Macarena plays a very important part of Semana Santa - Easter.

I lived in Seville for 3 years and never made it inside. The wait and visit was so worth it.

It's truly a stunning church. It's very busy with worshippers with added to my enjoyment, I like 'living churches' and this is certainly that.

It's says that you can't wear shorts but I saw worshippers going in with shorts. I asked the worshipper and see said no problem.

If you are staying in the Macarena area or passing by it's well worth visiting. If you only have 1-2 days and never been to Seville before their other churches nearer the centre worth seeing. Come and see this church when you next visit Seville

Sevilla, Basilica de la Macarena, surrounding neighbourhood 'Macarena'¬†is the working-class district of¬†Seville¬†and the Basilica is very popular with the locals. Next to the basilica is the Arco de la Macarena. Bas√≠lica is a neo-Baroque church building dating from: 1949 in honour of the virgin Mary 'La Virgen de la Esperanza Macarena'. The statue of the Virgin is surrounded by expensive relics, above the great altar of the Basilica. The Madonna statue is one of the most famous procession figures of¬†Seville.

Beautiful old Church in a very historic location at the ancient City walls.  Worth visiting to understand the history of the City.  Can be very busy but so ornate and worth a bit of time to sit and contemplate.

places.address: Pl. de la Esperanza Macarena, 1, Casco Antiguo, 41002 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the Santa Cruz neighborhood of Sevilla, Spain, AIRE Ancient Baths Sevilla is housed in a historic Mudejar style mansion. The spa offers a unique experience with its tour of water rooms at varying temperatures and candlelit ambiance. Guests can indulge in ancient bathing rituals, including thermal baths and steam rooms, culminating in an outdoor pool with views of the Alcazar.

sources.snippet: Hidden away in the Jewish Quarter of the city, Aire de Sevilla is the perfect romantic escape for any couple. Forget the stresses of life and enjoy some quality time with your loved one with an amazing massage, then share a relaxing dip in the dimly lit pools of the Arab baths.
sources.shortName: 6 Romantic Things To Do In Seville (on Valentine‚Äôs Day and All Year Long

places.name: AIRE Ancient Baths Sevilla

reviews.text: Not a lot to compare to, but this was a great experience for my wife and me! The staff was amazing and I cannot say enough about the masseuse. Best massage in a long time. The contrasting baths, jacuzzi, and steam room were perfect after our visit to Alcazar in the morning. Great job AIRE!

3.5 stars. I've been to the one in Chicago several times. I enjoyed it here because the price is significantly lower than in US. I got the Blossom experience with exfoliation and scalp massage. Carolina was my person and she did a great job and was very friendly. As for the baths part, steam room was perfect, salt bath great but tiny. I came in off season so it wasn't such a problem. The whole situation was disorganized and poorly explained. I got scolded for taking a tiny cup of water in the warm pool. It's only for the lounge area apparently. Some of the staff was unfriendly. I speak a decent amount of Spanish, but struggle to communicate somethings. I feel like it would be easier if they just had a little two minute video and all different languages explaining the whole situation. There was some mold, a little bit here and there . It's an extremely humid environment, so maybe there's not much to be done about that, I don't know. Overall, it was a good experience. If I was local, I would go again, assuming it isn't overcrowded the rest of the year.

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
Stunning location and great staff, but my experience felt a bit rushed.

The walk to AIRE through Sevilla's historic streets was beautiful, and the setting itself is impressive, candlelit baths inside an ancient palace really do set the mood. The staff were excellent from the start: welcoming, helpful, and professional.

My massage at 9 p.m. was genuinely very good, but I felt a little rushed because of the late time slot. The shared massage room setup (separated only by curtains) also made it less private and relaxing than I had hoped. On top of that, the space was louder than expected, which took away from the tranquility.

Still, the quality of the massage and the overall atmosphere make this a memorable spot. I'd recommend going, but try to book an earlier appointment for the best experience.

- @pointstraveleat

places.address: C. Aire, 15, Casco Antiguo, 41004 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Seville is a city with an abundance of beautiful and historic landmarks, including the Torre del Oro. This outer defensive tower, built around 1220, has a name that sparks various theories about its origins. The city also boasts other must-see attractions such as the Giralda, the Cathedral of Seville, Reales Alcazares (Arabic Palace), and many more.

sources.snippet: Overlooking the Guadalquivir River, Torre del Oro (Golden Tower) is another iconic location that offers both historical charm and a romantic riverside atmosphere. Originally built as a defensive watchtower, it now serves as a beautiful backdrop for a proposal with sweeping views of the city and river. For a truly special proposal, consider timing it for sunset.
sources.siteName: Local Photo Tour | Hire Local Photographers for your vacations
sources.shortName: 8 Best Places to Propose in Seville: Iconic and Intimate Spots

sources.snippet: When the sun goes down, take a stroll down by the river from the Torre del Oro towards the iconic Puente de Isabel II, an especially beautiful sight at night. Then settle into one of the riverside bars for a drink to cap off a perfect romantic evening in Seville!
sources.shortName: 6 Romantic Things To Do In Seville (on Valentine‚Äôs Day and All Year Long

sources.snippet: This twelve-sided, historic watchtower holds a lot of historical significance. It was built around 1220 by the Almohads. Initially, it was part of the Moorish city wall that surrounded the city and it was connected to the Torre de la Plata (the silver tower).
sources.shortName: Your Ultimate Guide: One Day in Romantic Seville, Spain

sources.snippet: The river offers stunning views of Seville‚Äôs skyline, including the Torre del Oro and the Triana Bridge. A private boat cruise at sunset creates a peaceful and romantic atmosphere, perfect for couples who want to enjoy Seville from a different perspective.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaways and Dining in Seville

sources.snippet: You will pass by the most representative monuments of the city centre such as the Torre del Oro or the Cathedral of Seville. It‚Äôs the perfect opportunity to take beautiful pictures!
sources.shortName: Seville for couples: a romantic guide
A Guide to the Most Romantic City in Andalucia

places.name: Torre del Oro

reviews.text:
Visiting the Torre del Oro was a fantastic experience and a highlight of my trip to Seville. This historic tower, standing proudly along the Guadalquivir River, offers not only a glimpse into Seville's maritime past but also some of the best panoramic views of the city.
The architecture of the tower is striking, with its Moorish design and golden hue that gives it its name. The small naval museum inside was an interesting stop, showcasing artifacts, maps, and models that illustrate Seville's rich connection to naval exploration. While the museum is relatively modest, it provides great insight into the tower's historical significance.
Climbing to the top was the best part. The view of the river, the Cathedral, and the city's rooftops was absolutely stunning-perfect for photos! It's especially breathtaking at sunset.

The entrance fee was quite reasonable, and the visit didn't take too long, making it an easy stop to fit into a busy itinerary. If you're in Seville and love history, architecture, or simply great views, I highly recommend adding the Torre del Oro to your must-visit list ü§©ü§©

Definitely Worth visiting the spectacular naval museum Torre del Oro. The entrance was free of charge. On my first visit, there was a crowded tourist group and a long queue, so I decided to come back later. One hour later the tower was suitable. On the first floor, a souvenir store is available, upper floors are museum full of naval relics and info. The top of the tower is a kind of terrace and has a nice view of the surroundings.

Free entry, they will ask you for any donation at the entry, even if it's ¬£1 they will be happy so you choose the price of your ticket!

Very interesting and has lovely ship models with a lot of history facts to learn.

At the top you can take a picture of a lovely view of the city!

places.address: The Golden Tower, P.¬∫ de Crist√≥bal Col√≥n, s/n, Casco Antiguo, 41001 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Murillo Gardens is a serene urban park in Seville, featuring well-maintained pathways, shaded seating areas, and historic monuments. It's part of the must-visit attractions in Seville, along with other iconic landmarks like Reales Alcazares and the Cathedral of Seville. The gardens are named after the 17th-century painter Murillo and offer a peaceful retreat from the city's hustle and bustle.

sources.snippet: Continue to the Murillo Garden and make romantic each step in this beautiful walkside. Then, we arrive to the next destination of this romantic route.
sources.shortName: Romantic date in Seville: A route map

places.name: Murillo Gardens

reviews.text: FIVE STARS ‚Äì Beautiful greenery and wide spaces to slow down and walk comfortably in the city... Interesting monuments, as this one depicting Christopher Columbus' ship, the Santa Maria, named after Queen Isabella.
Beautiful garden, most people use this path to get to another side of the palace

An excellent urban park.  Both shaded and sunny, well-maintained paths for strolling suitable for wheeled travelers (strollers and wheelchair users).  Stately trees - palms, Ficus and others.  Lots of songbirds.  A play area for children and lots of benches for resting, relaxing, and chatting. Worth a visit as part of a tour of the area around the Alcazar.

March 30, 2025
C & J

places.address: Av. de Men√©ndez Pelayo, Casco Antiguo, 41004 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Palacio de las Due√±as, a grand palace dating back to the late 1400s, offers a fascinating glimpse into Andalusian aristocratic life. Over the centuries, it has been home to notable figures such as Empress Eugenie de Montijo and Alfonso XIII, as well as serving as a residence for famous guests like Jacqueline Kennedy and Grace Kelly.

sources.snippet: At Maria Jos√©‚Äôs cozy apartment near Palacio de Due√±as, couples can enjoy a private Andalusian feast. The menu reflects Seville‚Äôs culinary heritage: Iberian ham and cheese, a refreshing Cordoban salmorejo, and Iberian pork tenderloin with garlic and pine nuts. To finish the meal, indulge in traditional churros with chocolate.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaways and Dining in Seville

sources.snippet: With so many beautiful attractions in Seville, you might think it‚Äôs okay to skip Las Due√±as, a palace located near the city‚Äôs old town, but don‚Äôt do it!
sources.shortName: 17 Magical Things to Do in Seville

places.name: Palacio de las Due√±as

reviews.text: We spent a truly wonderful afternoon at Palacio de las Due√±as. It was our first time visiting, and it came highly recommended as one of Seville's hidden gems and it did not disappoint. The palace is full of charm and history, with beautiful architecture, peaceful gardens, and fascinating exhibitions that give insight into Seville's noble past. There is an entrance fee, but it's absolutely worth it for the experience. If you're looking for a quieter, less crowded spot in the city that still offers rich culture and beauty, this place is a must-visit.

Lovely Palace. Much quieter than other places, which makes the visit even more pleasant. The patios are beautiful and refreshing. You can either use their online audio guide or on site they will provide you one.

Wonderful self guided tour!!  Plan to take about 45 minutes.  It has an audio guide you can listen to in multiple languages. You can access via your phone or the gift shop has devices you can use for this purpose.  A neat act is that someone actually lives in the building. He doesn't have much meaning for them or seeing them.   I believe the cost was roughly 14 euros.  I recommend doing the audio tour as you go through. You can skip ahead at any time, the rooms are numbered so you know which audio to select. There was some minor road construction leading to the palace, but there are signs to ensure that you can find your way

places.address: C. Due√±as, 5, Casco Antiguo, 41003 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: El Rinconcillo is a historic 17th-century restaurant located in Seville, Spain. It holds the distinction of being the oldest bar in Spain, serving wine and food since 1670. The establishment's traditional character is evident through its ceramic-tiled walls adorned with ham hocks and hundreds of bottles of wine and liquor displayed on elegant wood shelves. The menu features Andalusian classics such as fried cod fingers, diced pork in savory sauce, and spinach with chickpeas.

sources.snippet: Now, it‚Äôs time to relax and unwind with delicious drinks and tapas. El Rinconcillo is incredibly famous in Seville seeing as it is the oldest tapas bar in the city. Established in 1670, it recently celebrated 350 years!
sources.shortName: Your Ultimate Guide: One Day in Romantic Seville, Spain

sources.snippet: First opened in 1670 as a tavern, El Rinconcillo slowly expanded, until, by 1858. it reached its current-day shape and size.
sources.shortName: 17 Magical Things to Do in Seville
A Guide to the Most Romantic City in Andalucia

places.name: El Rinconcillo

reviews.text:
Restaurant Dinner review.

Wow. Had the best meal here. Visited on a Wednesday night and had booked a table few weeks in advance. Prices are reasonable and service outstanding.

There is an English menu , special of day was Sea Bass filleted at the table so we had that, hake, sirloin and Pork Loin. With a nice salad too.  Washed down with plenty of wine.  Desserts wonderful as well.

We all loved the atmosphere and really couldn't have had a better meal. Highly recommended.

I was looking for something not touristic, authentic and nice, well this is the place. The place is usually very busy but I managed to have lunch choosing restaurant menu, but you can go with tapas as well if you prefer. The food was good and fresh so cannot complain. The waiter was very nice and kind. I took two huge dishes plus dessert and water, spent 35 euros which incredibly good price.
I will go back for sure to try tapas next time I go back to Sevilla.

We enjoyed our dinner a lot.
The staffs are friendly, the food are tasty, portions are enough, and the pricing is within expectations.

We started queue up at 753pm, without reservations, worrying about not able to get it. The queue wasn't that long, about 20 people before us. Right at 8pm the staffs opened the shutters, and started bringing people in.

We got a table upstairs, service was quick.

We had the signature salad, gazpacho, big clams cooked in wine sauce, croquettes, pork cheek in sauce, and pork shoulder. All are delicious. The sangria are tasty, and dessert of cheese cake is good.

Highly recommended!

places.address: C. Gerona, 40, Casco Antiguo, 41003 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Plaza de Toros de la Real Maestranza de Caballer√≠a de Sevilla, also known as La Maestranza, is a historic bullring dating back to 1761. It is the oldest bullfighting ring in the world and remains in use for traditional bullfights during the annual Seville Fair. The site also houses a museum showcasing the art of bullfighting.

sources.snippet: Curious about how bullfighting was conducted in the ancient era of Seville?. Then take a guided tour of the Plaza de Toros de la Real Maestranza de Caballer√≠a de Sevilla and learn about the significance of bullfighting in the ancient culture of the city. The capacity of the bullring is 12,000 and is the site of one of the most well-known bullfighting festivals in the world.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Seville

sources.snippet: See a bull fight in the Plaza de Toros or visit the bullring museum to learn all about the history of bullfighting, the matador's and thier cool outfits.
sources.shortName: A Guide to the Most Romantic City in Andalucia
Your Ultimate Guide: One Day in Romantic Seville, Spain

places.name: Plaza de Toros de la Real Maestranza de Caballer√≠a de Sevilla

reviews.text:
Visited here to learn about the culture of bullfighting. Learnt that it's one of a handful of Bullrings that still operate as one. This one has a lovely museum and art gallery, can even walk up into the stands and view the arena. If you want to learn about culture and history you should visit here.

We didn't have to queue to get in, bought tickets online. Used Google lens to translate information.

Really enjoyed this. Really, no crowd, as we had not made reservations. Did self guided tour. The only downside was I was with 3 other individuals that all tried to download the audio tour, and none of us had success. It was on a qr code. Still was a very interesting part of not only bullfighting history but also of the community. This is one that is still in operation. For someone who really has no interest, I might recommend missing it. I really wanted to understand more of history, and that was accomplished. My favorite part was being in the areana. We used google Translate to read a number of the document inside so that we may understand them. Was well worth the time and money.

What a wonderful visit, well worth stopping by. It cost 12Euros to get in.   I bought ticket at the arena.   Audio guide on several languages that you can listen to, so headphones/air pods help.  Some really neat photo opportunities to take selfies or a group photo.

Later in the day you get some shade if you want to sit in the stands, and view the arena from uo high!!

places.address: P.¬∫ de Crist√≥bal Col√≥n, 12, Casco Antiguo, 41001 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Restaurante San Marco Santa Cruz is a quaint and charming Italian restaurant in the old Jewish Quarter of Sevilla. The atmosphere is very romantic, with exposed brick walls and a terrace that overlooks the city. The food is excellent, full of traditional Spanish dishes including pizza, all served in an enchanting setting.

sources.snippet: A romantic trip is not complete without a romantic dinner; and he restaurant San Marco Santa Cruz It is without a doubt one of the most beautiful places that the Sevillian lands have. to taste a delicious dish of exquisite Italian-Mediterranean cuisine. In addition to having at your disposal a select wine list, and a wide variety of homemade desserts to enjoy in the company of your partner.
sources.shortName: The 9 Romantic Places in Seville that will surprise you

sources.snippet: Restaurante San Marco serves good reasonable priced Italian food. I know you should be good tourist and be eating nothing but Spanish food however, this is located in what used to be Moorish baths in the middle ages. The place is air conditioned and not too far from the cathedral.
sources.shortName: A Guide to the Most Romantic City in Andalucia

places.name: San Marco Santa Cruz

reviews.text: Incredible! I would give 10 stars if i could. Our last night in Sevilla made special by the attentive and excellent wait staff who were fantastic. The food was sublime, the fresh ravioli was some of the best i have ever had and the portion sizes were just right. Make sure you save some room for dessert they were spectacular!

I had a great experience at San Marco Santa Cruz in Seville. The interior is quaint and unique-kind of like dining in a cozy little cave, with its stone walls and intimate atmosphere. As a vegetarian, I was impressed by the variety of delicious options, from hearty pastas to flavorful pizzas, all made with fresh ingredients. The service was excellent-friendly and attentive. Plus, it's located right next to some major sights, making it a perfect spot to stop for a meal after exploring. Highly recommend it for anyone looking for great Italian food in a charming setting.

‚ú® San Marco Restaurant ‚Äì Seville ‚ú®

This restaurant is truly unique as it is located inside a historic Andalusian Hammam (Arab bath) that has been beautifully transformed into a fine dining restaurant. The arched brick walls, ancient columns, and soft lighting create a magical and romantic atmosphere, making you feel like you are dining inside history.

üçΩÔ∏è Ambience:
Elegant, calm, and full of character ‚Äì perfect for a romantic dinner or a quiet evening with family and friends.

üë®‚Äçüç≥ Staff & Service:
The staff were very friendly and attentive, offering helpful suggestions and even guiding us toward halal options üïå, which was truly appreciated.

üé∂ Special Touch:
The presence of a live musician added an extra layer of charm and warmth to the whole experience.

üìå Note:
The restaurant is quite popular, so a reservation is highly recommended üìû.

üåü A memorable dining experience in Seville that we would definitely recommend!

places.address: C. Mes√≥n del Moro, 6, Casco Antiguo, 41003 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Tablao Flamenco Azahar in Sevilla is a small, intimate venue that offers a spectacular and unforgettable flamenco experience. The performers are incredibly talented and passionate, creating an energetic and emotional atmosphere. The setting is cozy and welcoming, as it is a family-run business. Audience members feel like they are part of the show due to the close proximity to the stage.

sources.snippet: The neighbourhood of Santa Cruz has something magical about it. Seville‚Äôs old Jewish quarter is where you can enjoy the best tapas and the best flamenco, with bars with long histories and unique atmospheres.
sources.shortName: Romantics plans for two in Seville

places.name: Casa Flamenco Azahar

reviews.text: It was a great experience. Art is beyond language boundaries. Our emotion flew with the artists' performance. The guitar, the voice and the dancing took you to a far away place and one can be immersed  in the sadness, joy and all the indescribable feelings brought by that one hour time. Officially a flamingo fan.

I don't know how to shout loudly enough about just how beautiful this experience was!!
It's in a very small room, with only a small audience, and feels very intimate.
The dancing, the guitarist, and the singer, were each masters of their own craft, and together were a beautiful trio. It was incredibly moving and emotional, and the can't recommend this highly enough. A night we will always remember.
Very good, intimate and authentic flamenco. You can smell the sweat. üòÅ Only 25 seats, lots of heart and highly recommended.

places.address: C. Cruces, 7, Casco Antiguo, 41004 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Casa de Pilatos is a stunning palace located at no 1, Plaza de Pilatos, dating back to the fifteenth century. It was created through the union of two noble families and reflects their love for Renaissance art. The palace features internal courtyards adorned with Greek and Roman statues, as well as an impressive collection of artworks. Over time, it underwent comprehensive remodeling that incorporated Romantic elements and features.

sources.snippet: Another exciting couple things to do in Seville  is visiting Casa De Pilatos that greets you with beautiful and aesthetically pleasing interiors, well furnished sitting areas, dreamy fountains and patios wherein you can have a time of your life.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Seville

sources.snippet: Casa de Pilatos is one of Seville‚Äôs best-kept secrets and a must-stop attraction during any first-time visit to the city.
sources.shortName: 17 Magical Things to Do in Seville
A Guide to the Most Romantic City in Andalucia

places.name: Casa de Pilatos

reviews.text: The architecture, mosaics, sculptures and gardens of this palace is world class and very unique. A must visit for everyone who enjoy aesthetics as well as art history. We spent a long time here to enjoy all the different rooms and outdoor areas.

This is a less known site however worth visiting. It has beautifully preserved palace blending various styles including Gothic and Renaissance architecture. Beautiful courtyards filled with delicate art and various statues. A lot to see and we were not able to see the upstairs residence rooms. Has a nice garden and a lot of corners to take photos.

I thought it would be much smaller than it was! Walked in when passing by and saw that it might be a nice stop but it was so much more! Lots of rooms and courtyards to explore. Allow time to walk around and appreciate the effort put into creating such a special place. Provides a glimpse into the history that shaped this blend of art and cultural styles.

places.address: Pl. de Pilatos, 1, Casco Antiguo, 41003 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Bar Catedral Sevilla is a delightful tapas spot nestled on the bustling Calle Mateos Gago, just a stone's throw from the magnificent cathedral. This charming two-story establishment boasts an inviting atmosphere adorned with bullfighting decor and offers outdoor seating that provides stunning views of the cathedral. It's an ideal location for both people-watching and indulging in classic Spanish tapas. Visitors can enjoy a diverse menu featuring traditional dishes like garlic shrimp and fried squid rings, alongside refreshing drinks.

sources.shortName: Romantic date in Seville: A route map

places.name: Bar Catedral Sevilla

reviews.text: Every time I've visited Seville, I've come to this restaurant. You get your food really quickly! My absolute favorites are number 24 and 14 ‚Äì definitely a must-try! The portion sizes for the tapas are quite decent for ‚Ç¨4.50. Some tapas are quite small, but I love coming here to enjoy my two favorite dishes. The waiters are polite, and the service is very fast.

I had an incredible meal here! The paella was absolutely delicious-the combination of the perfectly cooked rice and tender calamari was pure perfection. Every bite was packed with rich flavors, making it one of the best paellas I've had.

The tortilla de patatas was also amazing-soft, flavorful, and just the right texture. However, the Gambas al Ajillo didn't quite live up to the rest of the meal. It lacked the bold garlic and olive oil flavors I was expecting.

Overall, though, the experience was fantastic, and I would definitely come back for that paella and tortilla de patatas!

Tucked away in a great location in the heart of the Jewish quarter in Seville's old town, this charming tapas bar and restaurant made for a lovely dining experience. The food was fresh and the portions were generous - definitely more than just a nibble!

The chicken was nicely cooked and tender, though it could've used a bit more seasoning. The squid, on the other hand, was absolutely delicious and a standout dish. The quinoa side was a bit bland, but still enjoyable when paired with the other flavours.

Overall, I'd recommend this spot and would definitely go back. Great atmosphere, solid food, and a perfect place to take a break while exploring the historic streets of Seville.

places.address: C. Mateos Gago, 5, Casco Antiguo, 41004 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Barrio de Santa Cruz, located in Seville, was once the Jewish quarter until the Jews were expelled in 1483. The area is famous for its whitewashed houses and narrow cobbled streets that make it easy to get lost in its maze. This neighborhood has inspired numerous literary and operatic works and is a place where history can be felt. It's recommended to wander aimlessly through its streets to uncover its secrets.

sources.snippet: This converted mansion in Santa Cruz quarter mixes exposed brick and original floor tiles with chandeliers and glitzy gold headboards for a luxe-historic feel. The large roof terrace has unbeatable 360-degree views of both the Alcazar and the cathedral, plus plenty of seating; a decent-sized pool edged with glass walls allows full advantage of that vista while you float. Elegant rooms are tastefully decorated, with champagne stucco or exposed brick walls and brocade bedding.
sources.shortName: Best romantic hotels in Seville

sources.snippet: Adriano Hotel in Seville informs his distinguished clientele we have compiled a list of the most romantic places in Seville: 1.- Santa Cruz Quarter. It is not unusual that one of the most important Jewish quarter of Spain is chosen as one of the most romantic places, in the heart of Seville, Arabic layout with narrow streets and small courtyards with charm, you can hear the flow of water from its sources in the silence of the streets. Importantly, the Callejon del Agua, next to the wall, where you can discover a real Sevillian courtyard.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places in Seville

places.name: Barrio de Santa Cruz

reviews.text: What an amazing neighborhood to explore! The cute narrow streets and beautiful architecture with colorful apartments create such a charming atmosphere. You'll find local caf√©s on every corner, perfect for a quick break or a leisurely coffee. I can't say enough good things about this area-it's vibrant and full of life, with such positive vibes all around!

The former Jewish quarter of the medieval city. It was once the site of the Iglesia de Santa Cruz (Church of the Holy Cross).  The neighbourhood underwent a major process of urban renewal, including the conversion of a former synagogue into the current Church of Saint Bartholomew. Picturesque place. Must see place.  Free entry
Toilets nearby. Popular place, lots of tourists and locals - narrow streets. Wear comfy shoes, take water, wear hat, sunscreen. Level terrain, lots of walking. Great place for photography

You could spend an entire afternoon wandering around this neighborhood. Endless little shops, restaurants, bars & cafes.  Some of the streets are so small you could stretch your arms across and touch both walls.

places.address: C. Mes√≥n del Moro, 1, Casco Antiguo, 41004 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Located in Seville, Abades Triana Restaurante offers a delightful dining experience with its picturesque views of the river and iconic landmarks. The restaurant's elegant and contemporary design creates a refined ambiance for an upscale meal. The menu features a variety of flavors, including Moorish-influenced dishes and traditional Spanish and Mediterranean favorites. Additionally, guests can indulge in a selection of caviars for a luxurious touch.

sources.snippet: Perhaps the most appropriate for a special romantic night is Abades Triana, where the food is great but the views across the river are absolutely spectacular. This is the place to go if a candlelit dinner is top of your list of romantic things to do in Seville.
sources.shortName: 6 Romantic Things To Do In Seville (on Valentine‚Äôs Day and All Year Long

places.name: Abades Triana Restaurante

reviews.text: With its beautiful atmosphere, stunning view, and attentive staff, this has quickly become my favourite restaurant in Seville. I went for the ‚Äúexploration of unique gastronomic experiences‚Äù set menu and it was a treat, great value for money and full of memorable flavours. The amuse-bouche and sea bass were absolute chef's kiss. Perfect for a romantic night out, and one I'd strongly recommend.

The restaurant and its setting along the river were beautiful, but for top dollar prices, the food and service were disappointing. One waiter was excellent and friendly, but the second server was rather rude, and brought my husband a drink in a dirty glass, and then did not replace the drink when she brought a new, empty glass. She also did not check in once after the food was delivered to see if we needed anything (which we did... a new drink!) The food should have been excellent but was mediocre instead. My husband's steak was just okay and small for the price. My rice and scallops had only one large scallop, sliced thinly, at the bottom of the bowl. For that price and that level of dining experience, I expected 5-6 large scallops. The rice was fine, but nothing exceptional. This was supposed to be a celebratory dinner, but it was more hype than value. We weren't even seated next to the window, so there wasn't much of a view. I really wanted to love this place, but I won't return.

Sincere recommendations for Abades Triana Restaurant! From excellent communication for the reservation, purchasing a bouquet, and the outstanding service of all the staff, thank you so much! I highly recommend this restaurant to everyone. We will always remember your restaurant and Seville because this marks a new beginning for us. I'm leaving pictures in the review. ‚ù§Ô∏è

places.address: C. Betis, 69, 41010 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Agust√≠n & Company Bar de Tapas is a lively spot in Seville, offering Andalusian tapas and an extensive selection of wines and beers. The bar is adorned with sepia photos, creating a vibrant atmosphere for young patrons. Situated overlooking El Salvador Square, the multicultural ambiance and carefully curated decor pay homage to artistic photography from the last century. The restaurant offers a variety of language options on their menus and boasts multilingual staff.

sources.shortName: Romantic date in Seville: A route map

places.name: Agust√≠n & Company Bar de Tapas

reviews.text: We stopped in as we were walking the streets looking for a place to eat and his place was buzzing! It had a warm charming vibe and did not disappoint! We had warm goat cheese with peach marmalade and grilled octopus and confit codfish over ratatouille. We loved that you. Can choose the size of your dish: tapa, medium or full plate. The food was fabulous. We also enjoyed the sangria. We highly recommend this place for tapas.

Sevilla is truly blessed with a high concentration of decent restaurants. If you need a break from your sightseeing (or just to get away from the blistering Andalusian summer sun), every street presents numerous cool and inviting opportunities that can slake both thirst and appetite.

We ducked into this busy restaurant ostensibly for a cool drink after watching a youth marching band perform nearby. Our plans, as usual, quickly changed to having an early dinner after seeing other patrons being served with mouth watering dishes.

We ordered the pork cheeks (bite size chunks cooked till tender), salmorejo (tomato based cold soup, super refreshing, perfect as a starter), grilled baby squid with diced tomatoes and a heavy dressing of olive oil with balsamic vinegar ( very fresh, not over cooked, still soft and chewy).

However, our favorite must have been the tortillitas de camarones. Tiny shrimp embedded in a thin and light batter of chickpea flour fried till crispy. This is the perfect crispy savory snack to go with your ice cold apperitif.

The chirpy and attentive service staff all speak pretty decent English so ordering was a breeze (they have an English menu). Indoor seating for maybe 25 -30 with additional outdoor seating if you don't mind the siesta inducing heat. If there weren't so many other places to eat from we'd have ended up here more often!

We had an outstanding dining experience! The grilled squid was perfectly tender and full of flavor, beautifully complemented by fresh tomato slices and a vibrant green herb sauce that made every bite refreshing and delicious. The octopus was another highlight-expertly cooked to a tender yet smoky perfection, served over seasoned potatoes with just the right touch of paprika and a creamy sauce that tied the whole dish together. To finish, we enjoyed a traditional flan de huevo, which was silky, rich, and wonderfully balanced in sweetness. It was the perfect ending to an already exceptional meal.

On top of the fantastic food, the service truly made the experience special. Our waiter, Luis, was exceptionally friendly and attentive, making us feel welcome and well cared for throughout the meal and suggesting good local beers!

Highly recommend both the dishes and the wonderful service-definitely a place worth returning to!

places.address: C. √Ålvarez Quintero, 3, Casco Antiguo, 41004 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Habanita is a trendy restaurant with a charming courtyard that offers Cuban-inspired cuisine and an array of vegetarian tapas and cocktails. While it specializes in Caribbean-infused dishes, it also caters to vegetarians with a separate menu featuring an extensive selection, including unique options like banana meatballs in tomato sauce. The upscale establishment provides excellent service and features a lovely outdoor terrace.

sources.shortName: A Guide to the Most Romantic City in Andalucia

places.name: Habanita

reviews.text: The food was very delicious! A lot of vego and vegan options. I got the Yukka, aubergine and vegan croquettes (only half serving each) and it was still good portions. Plus the service was great, very accommodating and kind.

Habanita in Seville offers a fantastic taste of Mexican-inspired cuisine with vibrant, bold flavors. The rice and beans were a highlight-perfectly seasoned and comforting. The croquettes were crispy and creamy, with a delicious filling that really hit the spot. The lasagna was a unique twist, hearty and full of flavor. While the portion sizes are on the smaller side, the prices are very reasonable, so it's great value for the quality of food. The cozy atmosphere and friendly service make it a solid choice for a casual yet satisfying meal.

Fantastic place to eat, especially for vegetarians. It's a hidden gem. Service is quick and custom made. In case of an allergy, the owner is more than willing to advise and prepare the food fresh. Great place to be! The food is delicious and the variety of the menu is perfect!

places.address: Cj√≥n. Golfo, 3, Casco Antiguo, 41004 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Perched atop the five-star EME Catedral Mercer Hotel, La Terraza del EME offers panoramic views of Seville Cathedral and the surrounding rooftops. This stylish venue is perfect for enjoying sundowners while taking in the breathtaking sunset. The bar serves a variety of cocktails and spirits, with a wide selection of gins and whiskies available. While there's no reservation system in place, arriving in the late afternoon ensures the best sunset view.

sources.snippet: Venues like La Terraza de EME offer stunning views of the Giralda and the cathedral, setting the perfect backdrop for a romantic evening.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaways and Dining in Seville

places.name: La Terraza del EME

reviews.text: Great service, delicious drinks and a lovely view of the cathedral. We visited twice as we enjoyed it so much. Prices are higher than other local bars but considering the location and views it is understandable and worth it.

great place for a cathedral sunset view. drinks are about ‚Ç¨15 each and they're honestly worth it. it took us about 25 minutes to get the check and we had to ask 2 servers plus a bartender. it's free to enter and I'd say absolutely worth it.

Absolutely stunning views of the cathedral and the wait staff was so lovely, even recommending us their favourite spots for sunset viewing. We were lucky and a private event had just finished, so plenty of tables available on a Wednesday night. The drink prices are steep but that's to be expected for the location. Oh and the music selection was great - could have stayed there all night, with deeper pockets.

places.address: C. Alemanes, 27, Casco Antiguo, 41004 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Calle Betis is a charming narrow street that runs along the river, offering a vibrant mix of bars and restaurants. The Vela de Santiago y Santa Ana festival, held from July 21st to July 26th, brings fun fairs, food and craft booths, and lively after-dark atmosphere to the area. Across the bridge in Triana neighborhood, more bars with diverse music await on Calle Betis.

sources.snippet: From this riverside street in the neighbourhood of Triana, you can enjoy one of the city‚Äôs most beautiful views at sunset. Take a beautiful stroll and contemplate the Guadalquivir river, the Tower of Gold and the Giralda, and end up by the Triana bridge. This is one of the symbols of the neighbourhood and is Spain‚Äôs oldest preserved iron bridge.
sources.shortName: Romantics plans for two in Seville

places.name: Calle Betis

reviews.text: A perfect street to see the center of Seville from the other side. In addition to the bridges, you can have a panoramic view that includes the Plaza de Toros (bullring), the Seville Cathedral and the Torre del Oro. Consider visiting at the end of the day and after sunset, due to the extreme heat and lack of shade.
Calle Betis it's a famous street in the neighborhood of Triana. You will enjoy the views of the Guadalquivir river from this side of the river in Calle/ Street Betis.
Not a great place. It is in the Triana area of Seville. This place is on the banks of the Guadalquivir River. Except for a few restaurants around, this place has nothing much to offer for a tourist.

places.address: C. Betis, 26, 41010 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Pelayo Bar is a charming and inviting spot that offers a diverse menu featuring creative local tapas, seafood, and meat plates alongside an excellent selection of wine. Located near the Cathedral in Seville Old Town, this lively bar boasts a wider range of cuisine influenced by Italian, Mediterranean, and European flavors in addition to traditional Spanish dishes. The bar also features a gourmet store and deli offering top-quality products from Cadiz province and beyond, as well as an impressive selection of sherry wines.

sources.shortName: Romantic date in Seville: A route map

places.name: Pelayo Bar

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this place for visitors to Sevilla - there are menus in multiple languages and the service is high quality and professional. I ordered the gazpacho, bull tail croquetas, pork loin in whiskey and Cantabrian anchovies on bread with avocado. It was the perfect way to enjoy some tapas. My partner ordered the huevos rotos and the portion size was very generous! The bulls heads in the restaurant, the mist that cools you down after you walk in from the hot Andalucian sun and the positive atmosphere are really welcoming and pleasant.

Nice atmosphere in a vibrant and busy tapas bar on a side street facing the Giralda. Met a friend, and we shared a decent sangria. I ordered the Salmorejo, Ham Croquettes, Artichoke Hearts with Jamon and Gulas. Service was a bit slow, but they were busy, and we were not rushed.
Almost had more of a British pub kind of vibe but the menu is straight tapas.  The garlic shrimp was not very garlicky.  The pork cheek in traditional sauce over fries was very good.  Pretty place.

places.address: C. de Placentines, 25, Casco Antiguo, 41004 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Seville's Arenal district, the Iglesia de La Caridad, also known as Se√±or San Jorge, is a stunning example of Baroque architecture that dates back to the 17th century. This beautiful church was originally built as a chapel for the Hospital de la Santa Caridad and showcases an elegant facade adorned with intricate stone sculptures and a charming dome. Inside, visitors can marvel at exquisite paintings by renowned artist Murillo, making it a must-see for art lovers.

sources.snippet: Visit the Basilica de la Macarena, to get a glimse at the two most impressive floats used during Semana Santa (Holy Week).
sources.shortName: A Guide to the Most Romantic City in Andalucia

places.name: Iglesia de La Caridad

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) Guided group tour is well worth it, it is pleasantly surprising. The staff that works there are very friendly.

(Original)
Visita de grupo guiada merece mucho la pena, sorprende gratamente. Muy amable el personal que trabaja all√≠
Mystic place with clay figures. It really is an old building that you can observe as a work of Baroque art. There is a black cat inside...

(Translated by Google) The fa√ßade of the church, a representative work of the Sevillian baroque, is structured in three sections in height and presents a scheme of great constructive simplicity. The two upper sections are decorated with tiles that represent their patrons Saint George and Saint James and the three theological virtues, Faith, Hope and Charity. Further down, on both sides of the door, there are sculptures of King Ferdinand III and Saint Hermenegildo. The fa√ßade is topped by an attic preceded by an iron railing and flanked by two brick pinnacles.

The church has a single nave covered with a barrel vault and a small dome in the antipresbytery. The walls are articulated with pilasters and Corinthian pilasters that support a cornice with a projecting eaves. At the foot of the church is the choir, raised on a triple arch. The temple is decorated with plasterwork that presents abstract shapes in its central nave.

(Original)
La fachada de la iglesia, obra representativa del barroco sevillano, se encuentra estructurada en tres cuerpos de altura y presenta un esquema de gran simplicidad constructiva. Los dos tramos superiores se encuentran decorados con azulejos que representan a sus patronos San Jorge y Santiago y a las tres virtudes teologales, Fe, Esperanza y Caridad. M√°s abajo, a los dos lados de la puerta se contemplan esculturas del rey Fernando III y San Hermenegildo. La fachada aparece rematada por un √°tico precedido por una baranda de hierro y flanqueado por dos pin√°culos de ladrillo.

La iglesia es de una sola nave cubierta con b√≥veda de ca√±√≥n y una peque√±a c√∫pula en el antipresbiterio. Los muros se articulan con pilastrones y pilastras corintias que sostienen una cornisa de saliente alero. A los pies de la iglesia se encuentra el coro, elevado sobre una arcada triple. El templo se encuentra decorado con yeser√≠as que en su nave central presenta formas abstractas.

places.address: C. Temprado, Casco Antiguo, 41001 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: Isleta de los P√°jaros, located within Seville's Maria Luisa Park, is a hidden gem that attracts various bird species. While some visitors find the area to be overfed and not fearful enough, others appreciate the diverse bird population. This beautiful pond is often overlooked by tourists but offers a tranquil and pastoral atmosphere with ducks and swans.

sources.snippet: Also located in Parque de Mar√≠a Luisa, Isleta de los P√°jaros is a small island surrounded by a charming pond, home to swans and lush greenery. In the middle of the pond, stands the exquisite Pabell√≥n de Alfonso XII, a small yet elegant pavilion perfect for an intimate proposal in Seville. This Arab-inspired pavilion still goes unnoticed by many tourists, meaning you‚Äôll have the privacy needed to create an unforgettable moment.
sources.siteName: Local Photo Tour | Hire Local Photographers for your vacations
sources.shortName: 8 Best Places to Propose in Seville: Iconic and Intimate Spots

sources.snippet: Have you ever wish to feel like the prince or princess from the love stories?. You are lucky: you can do it in Seville!. Inside the Maria Luisa Park there is a hidden place that few visitors know.
sources.shortName: best places to visit if you just got married ‚Äì Photo Tour Seville ‚Äì Things to do, activities and what to see in Seville

places.name: Isleta de los P√°jaros

reviews.text: Little area in the park that attracts lots of people and birds. It seems to be the most stay around to take photos, walking their dogs, etc. In the late afternoon, the smells can be a bit much. On the warm day, there are mosquitos in the early evening. Watch out for that.

Nice spot in this beautiful Park.
But I'd recommend to visit it only if you are 2 days and more in Seville as there are much more impressive places to visit.
We were there enough days and therefore could enjoy this relaxing and pastoral place with its ducks and especially swans.
Beautiful small pond that is usually ignored by visitors. You should definitely pass by it and watch the different type of bird that are here.

places.address: C. de Pizarro, 41013 Sevilla, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Tablao Flamenco en Sevilla offers a mesmerizing experience that transports you to a different time with its passionate and glorious flamenco show. The dancers, singers, and guitarists deliver spectacular performances in an intimate atmosphere, captivating the audience with their exceptional talent. The small venue provides a perfect setting for experiencing authentic storytelling through flamenco dancing, singing, and guitar playing. With self-service drinks available, it's a lovely way to immerse yourself in this art form while in Sevilla.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for romantic things to do in Seville‚Äîor things to do in Seville at night‚Äîput a flamenco performance on your itinerary!. And if you‚Äôre visiting during the fall months in Europe, be sure to see the monthlong Flamenco Biennial!
sources.shortName: 17 Magical Things to Do in Seville

sources.snippet: Flamenco is pure passion, and experiencing a live show is an intensely romantic experience. The flamenco tablaos offer nights filled with art and emotion. Choose Wisely: Some of the best tablaos are in the Santa Cruz neighborhood.
sources.shortName: Romantic Seville: A Local's Guide for Couples

sources.snippet: A flamenco show in a tablao (the place where flamenco shows take place) is indeed an obligatory stop for any tourist who comes to Seville and an original idea for a date to spend a pleasant evening with your special one.
sources.shortName: Seville for couples: a romantic guide

sources.snippet: The neighbourhood of Santa Cruz has something magical about it. Seville‚Äôs old Jewish quarter is where you can enjoy the best tapas and the best flamenco, with bars with long histories and unique atmospheres.
sources.shortName: Romantics plans for two in Seville

places.name: Tablao Flamenco en Sevilla | Flamenco Show in Seville

reviews.text: Absolutely amazing show. All 3 performers did a wonderful job. This was our 2nd flamenco show and by far the best so far. Couldn't recommend highly enough. Get there at least 30 minutes ahead and sit in the front row.

Terrible venue. Chairs are uncomfortable and you can not see the performers feet unless you are in the front row . The actual dancing was less then half the show, the rest was singing and guitar solo, which was nice but not what I paid 25 euro for.

I would highly recommend experiencing flamenco this way. Wonderful music in a small venue that is more a small theater than a bar, but there was sangria, beer and soft drinks for self-service. Simply a lovely way to see and hear this art form.

places.address: C. Alemanes, 19, Casco Antiguo, 41004 Sevilla, Spain
